alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; Shirley Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: High Wind Watch issued April 03 at 2:26AM MDT until April 05 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...West winds 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 70 mph possible. * WHERE...Ferris/Seminoe/Shirley Mountains, Shirley Basin and Central Carbon County. * WHEN...From Monday afternoon through Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Mainly to transportation. Strong cross winds may be hazardous to light weight and high profile vehicles, including campers and tractor trailers, with a potential high risk for blow overs.
info.instruction: A High Wind Watch means there is the potential for a hazardous high wind event. Sustained winds of at least 40 mph or gusts of 58 mph or stronger may occur. Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; Shirley Basin
